content.description: Climb the right side of a short spire to a small tree (tree equalized with half inch cam for an anchor).
content.protection: 3 bolts and a half inch cam for the anchor.
content.location:
Between

Route 3

and

Route 3

, climb the right side of a spire.

content.description: Climb up the left side of a spire to a small tree (a 1/2 inch cam can be equalized with tree with for an anchor).
content.protection: 3 bolts and 1/2" cam for the anchor.
content.location:
This climbs a short spire with a small tree at its top in between

Route 3

and

Route 3

.

content.description:
Climb a steep, right-facing corner to a foot ledge. Here, clip a bolt, then climb up to another bolt, and follow thin, insipient seams to the top (crux) with a b

olted anchor.
content.protection: A single racks 0.2-0.4. Bring small wired stoppers.
content.location: It is in the middle of the cliff on the left side of the climbing area.

content.description: Climb a thin crack into an alcove, climb out an alcove on thin crack and face holds, follow it to the top, and build a gear anchor.
content.location: There are three big boulders behind Area 53. Scramble up a gully between Route 3 and Route 4, and hike to them.

content.description: Climb an arete up a thin crack past a horizontal, and face climb past bolt up a crescent flake to more face climbing past another bolt to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.location: It is in the center of the cliff.

content.description: Follow a thin, crescent crack up to a bolt. Wandering face climbing will lead you past 3 more bolts to the top and a bolted anchor.
content.protection: Draws plus a 0.4-0.5 and a optional 00 for the start.
content.location: This is in the center of the cliff just right of a gully/weakness.

content.description: Climb cracks to a ledge. Here, follow slab to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.location:
It is in the center of the climbing area just left of

Route 4

. Start behind a small pine tree.

content.description:
Use the same start as

Route 1

, then climb a steep corner to a foot ledge. From here, climb up and right to a thin crack, transfer over to a thin hand crack, and follow it to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A single rack to 2", and bring small wires.
content.location:
On the left side of the cliff, begin with the same start as

Route 1

.

content.description: Climb a steep, right-facing corner in the center of a cliff to good foot ledge. Here, step left, clip a bolt, continue up and left, and follow thin, incipient cracks to the top with a bolted anchor.
content.protection: A single rack to 3". A red DMM offset is helpful.
content.location: On the left side of the cliff band, start below a steep, right-facing corner.
